Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky brown below; at left, trace of floral motif in added white; at right, tip of lotus flower in white outline; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924, 1201.722. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 722, no. 809)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 83, no. 87)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1851) (phase 2)
